content.text: Microfinance Banks (MFBs) play a crucial role in financial inclusion, providing banking services to underserved communities. The State Bank of Pakistan (SBP) regulates the licensing, operation, and supervision of MFBs under the Microfinance Institutions Ordinance, 2001.
The State Bank of Pakistan (SBP) is the sole authority for:

items: ‚úî Licensing Microfinance Banks (MFBs)
‚úî Regulating microfinance banking operations
‚úî Supervising MFB compliance with financial laws

content.text: No entity or individual can operate an MFB without an official SBP license.
To establish an MFB in Pakistan, applicants must meet SBP‚Äôs eligibility standards, which include:

items: ‚úî Entities with proven experience in microfinance, locally or internationally.
‚úî Companies with strong distribution networks or technological expertise for financial services.
‚úî Pakistani or foreign individuals/groups must first operate a Microfinance Institution (MFI) for at least three years before applying for an MFB license.
‚úî In exceptional cases, individuals with significant experience in Microfinance, Agriculture, or SME Finance may qualify directly for an MFB license.

content.text: Individuals cannot sponsor an MFB if they:

items: üö´ Have been convicted of a criminal offense in Pakistan or abroad.
üö´ Have engaged in illegal financial activities, especially violations of banking and corporate laws.
üö´ Have defaulted on financial obligations to banks or financial institutions.
‚úî Nationwide MFB Operations ‚Äì Minimum paid-up capital of PKR 500 million.
‚úî Province-wide MFB Operations ‚Äì Minimum paid-up capital of PKR 250 million.
‚úî District-wide MFB Operations ‚Äì Minimum paid-up capital of PKR 100 million.

content.text: üìå Sponsors must subscribe to at least 51% of the minimum capital, which is held by the SBP in custody. These shares cannot be transferred or encumbered without SBP‚Äôs prior written approval.

‚úî A business model demonstrating financial sustainability.

content.heading: Electronic Money Institution (EMI) License in Pakistan

content.text: The State Bank of Pakistan (SBP) regulates the Electronic Money Institutions (EMIs) to ensure secure and efficient digital financial transactions. Obtaining an EMI license allows companies to provide e-wallets, online payments, and digital financial services.

content.heading: Step-by-Step Process for Obtaining an EMI License

items: ‚úî Register a Limited Liability Company (LLC) with the Securities and Exchange Commission of Pakistan (SECP).
‚úî Choose between a Private or Public Limited Company structure.

content.text: Applicants must submit the following documents to SBP:

items: ‚úî Certificate of Incorporation from SECP.
‚úî Memorandum & Articles of Association.
‚úî Non-refundable application fee of PKR 200,000.

    - Five-year financial projections.
    - Operational plans for e-money issuance & redemption.
    - Delivery channels for digital payment services.

‚úî Customer fund protection plan, including:
    - Trust agreement with trustees for fund security.

‚úî Internal compliance mechanisms for:
    - Anti-Money Laundering (AML) compliance.
    - Countering Financing of Terrorism (CFT) regulations.

‚úî List of key personnel, including:
    - Sponsor shareholders, directors, CEO, and executives.
‚úî Audited financial statements (if applicable).

content.text: üìå All submitted documents must comply with SBP's Electronic Money Institution (EMI) Regulations.

items: ‚úî SBP reviews the application and grants initial approval.
‚úî The applicant must fulfill all conditions outlined by SBP before moving to the next phase.
‚úî After meeting initial requirements, the EMI is allowed to conduct real transactions on a limited scale.
‚úî This phase helps test operational systems and validate processes before full-scale launch.
‚úî Upon successful pilot testing, SBP grants final authorization.
‚úî The EMI can now start full-scale commercial activities in Pakistan's digital financial ecosystem.

content.text: To maintain regulatory compliance, EMIs must adhere to:

items:
‚úî Financial Resource Requirements
    - Maintain sufficient financial resources to support operations.
    - Implement risk management policies for secure transactions.

‚úî IT & Cybersecurity Systems
    - Use secure IT infrastructure for digital payments.
    - Ensure data protection and fraud prevention mechanisms.
    - Follow SBP‚Äôs Payment Systems and Electronic Fund Transfers Act, 2007.

‚úî Customer Fund Safeguarding
    - Maintain a Trust Account with a licensed bank.
    - Ensure customer funds remain protected from operational risks.

‚úî AML/CFT Compliance
    - Develop internal controls for anti-money laundering compliance.
    - Prevent financial crimes by adhering to SBP‚Äôs AML & CFT regulations.

content.text: A Trademark is a word, phrase, symbol, and/or design that identifies and distinguishes the source of the goods of one party from those of others. A service mark is a word, phrase, symbol, and / or design that identifies and distinguishes the source of a service rather than goods.

A patent is grant of exclusive rights for an invention to make, use and sell the invention for a limited period of 20 years. The patent grant excludes others from making, using, or selling the invention. Patent protection does not start until the actual grant of a patent.

An industrial design is the ornamental or aesthetic aspect of an article. The design may consist of three-dimensional features, such as the shape or surface of an article, or of two dimensional features, such as patterns, lines or colour.

Industrial designs are applied to a wide variety of products of industry and handicraft: from technical and medical instruments to watches, jewellery and other luxury items; from house wares and electrical appliances to vehicles and architectural structures; from textile designs to leisure goods.
An industrial design is primarily of an aesthetic or visual nature, and does not relate to the technical features of an article.

Copyright is a legal instrument that provides the creator of a work of art or literature, or a work that conveys information or ideas, the right to control how the work is used. The intent of copyright is to advance the progress of knowledge by giving an author of a work an economic incentive to create new works.
